required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Breast-Dedicated PET Camera With 1 Millimeter Spatial Resolution
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of a Breast-Dedicated PET Camera With 1 Millimeter Spatial Resolution

brief_summary.textblock: This is a research study of a novel, "breast-dedicated" positron emission tomography (PET) camera with 1 millimeter spatial resolution. The main goal of the study is for the personnel to understand practical and logistical issues with using the camera in the clinic

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary Objective To obtain initial experience using the novel, breast-dedicated PET camera design in the breast imaging clinic.
Secondary Objectives To understand, given the 10-fold higher sensitivity of this novel camera, how low we can go with administered tracer dose, and, given the >100-fold better volumetric spatial resolution, understand the achievable image quality.

primary_outcome.measure: Image quality with the breast-dedicated PET camera
primary_outcome.description: Feasibility of the pilot breast-dedicated PET camera will be assessed on the basis of whether acceptable images are obtained. Images will be assessed and graded as 1 of 3 quality ratings: excellent, good, and poor. The outcome will be reported as the number of images that are excellent, good, and poor, a number without dispersion.

arm_group.arm_group_label: 18-F FDG Study using Breast-Dedicated PET Camera
arm_group.description: Breast-Dedicated PET Camera will be used with standard PET 18-F FDG tracer dose

intervention.description: Participant will be injected IV (intravenously) with 10 ± 2 mCi of 18F-FDG.
intervention.arm_group_label: 18-F FDG Study using Breast-Dedicated PET Camera

intervention.description: Breast-dedicated PET camera designed by Stanford satellite radiochemistry facility
intervention.arm_group_label: 18-F FDG Study using Breast-Dedicated PET Camera

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Biopsy-confirmed breast cancer measuring ≥ 5 mm on mammogram or ultrasound.
- Prior diagnostic imaging test(s) with another modality such as MRI, CT, or x-ray mammography (or other applicable imaging modalities) within 60 days prior to the study date.
- Documented written informed consent document.
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. Additional condition, or extenuating circumstance that, in the opinion of the investigator, may interfere with study compliance.
- Known allergies to FDG
- Pregnant or nursing.
